li.Acceptance into the Department of Music: Acceptance into the Department of Music is conditional upon completion of a successful audition. Go to https://performingarts.cah.ucf.edu/music/program-requirements/ to learn more about specific audition requirements and recommended repertoire for each instrument and voice.
li.The audition will serve as a placement e: The audition will serve as a placement examination for accepted candidates.
li.During the fourth semester of applied st: During the fourth semester of applied study, each student will be required to pass the Professional Sequence Entrance Review, which will include the following:
li.Completion of Performance I and II: Completion of Performance I and II
li.Overall GPA of at least 2.5, and a GPA f: Overall GPA of at least 2.5, and a GPA for all music courses of at least 3.0.
li.This review is a pre-requisite for Perfo: This review is a pre-requisite for Performance level III.
li.Completion of the following courses:\nMU:
Completion of the following courses:
MUS 2360C - Introduction to Music Technology Credit Hours: 3
MUT 2127 - Music Theory and Musicianship IV Credit Hours: 4
li.MUS 2360C - Introduction to Music Techno: MUS 2360C - Introduction to Music Technology Credit Hours: 3
li.MUT 2127 - Music Theory and Musicianship: MUT 2127 - Music Theory and Musicianship IV Credit Hours: 4
li.Prior to attending the first music class: Prior to attending the first music class as a music major at UCF, all students must take a keyboard placement examination to determine the appropriate level of class piano. Go to https://performingarts.cah.ucf.edu/study/#musicundergrad to see the class piano requirements.
li.Students who change degree programs and: Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
li.At least 65 hours of credit must be earn: At least 65 hours of credit must be earned in music courses.
li.Departmental Residency Requirement; at l: Departmental Residency Requirement; at least 30 hours must be taken from the UCF Music department.
li.Performance students must present two fa: Performance students must present two faculty-approved public recitals.
li.Students should consult with a departmen: Students should consult with a departmental advisor for course selection.
li.Courses designated in General Education: Courses designated in General Education Program are usually completed throughout four years of study.
li.Students must complete a faculty-approve: Students must complete a faculty-approved Senior BM web portfolio.
li.A cumulative minimum GPA of 3.00 based u: A cumulative minimum GPA of 3.00 based upon all courses required in the major as well as all courses taken in music is required. Failure to maintain this standard may result in program probation or dismissal. Please refer to the SPA Student Handbook (http://performingarts.cah.ucf.edu/academics/student-resources) for details on program standards.

courseSection0.text:
Admission Requirements
Audition Requirements for Admission
Acceptance into the Department of Music is conditional upon completion of a successful audition. Go to https://performingarts.cah.ucf.edu/music/program-requirements/ to learn more about specific audition requirements and recommended repertoire for each instrument and voice.
The audition will serve as a placement examination for accepted candidates.
Professional Sequence Entrance Review
During the fourth semester of applied study, each student will be required to pass the Professional Sequence Entrance Review, which will include the following:
An evaluation of performance skills
Completion of Performance I and II
Completion of Class Piano IV
Overall GPA of at least 2.5, and a GPA for all music courses of at least 3.0.
This review is a pre-requisite for Performance level III.
Completion of the following courses:
MUS 2360C - Introduction to Music Technology Credit Hours: 3
MUT 2127 - Music Theory and Musicianship IV Credit Hours: 4
Degree Requirements
Prior to attending the first music class as a music major at UCF, all students must take a keyboard placement examination to determine the appropriate level of class piano. Go to https://performingarts.cah.ucf.edu/study/#musicundergrad to see the class piano requirements.
Students who change degree programs and select this major must adopt the most current catalog.
At least 65 hours of credit must be earned in music courses.
Departmental Residency Requirement; at least 30 hours must be taken from the UCF Music department.
Performance students must present two faculty-approved public recitals.
Students should consult with a departmental advisor for course selection.
Courses designated in General Education Program are usually completed throughout four years of study.
Students must complete a faculty-approved Senior BM web portfolio.
A cumulative minimum GPA of 3.00 based upon all courses required in the major as well as all courses taken in music is required. Failure to maintain this standard may result in program probation or dismissal. Please refer to the SPA Student Handbook (http://performingarts.cah.ucf.edu/academics/student-resources) for details on program standards.

li.Ensemble assignment is by the Ensemble d: Ensemble assignment is by the Ensemble directors.

li.Students taking a course in Performance: Students taking a course in Performance must concurrently take a major ensemble appropriate to their principal instrument or voice.
li.If Minor Ensemble is taken at UCF, the s: If Minor Ensemble is taken at UCF, the semester hours of credit must be spread over at least two separate semesters.
li.If Minor Ensemble credits are transferre: If Minor Ensemble credits are transferred to UCF, each remaining credit must be taken in a separate semester.
li.Minor Ensembles include: Brass, Percussi: Minor Ensembles include: Brass, Percussion, Piano, Madrigal Singers, Women's Chorus, Opera Workshop, Woodwind, Jazz Ensemble, Jazz Combo, and Early Music Ensemble.

li.Students interested in completing Honors: Students interested in completing Honors in the Major should contact their program advisor. More information about Honors in the Major can be found at http://research.honors.ucf.edu/honors-in-the-Major.
li.Lower division courses do not substitute: Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses transferred from private and out: Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide all supporting information.
li.Program Academic Learning Compacts (stud: Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm

courseSection0.text:
Restricted Electives
0-15 hrs
Any MUC, MUE, MUG, MUH, MUL, MUM, MUN, MUO, MUS, MUT, MVX courses numbered 3000 or higher.

courseSection2.text:
Electives
Select primarily from upper level courses. May be outside of the department.

courseSection3.text:
Foreign Language Requirements
Admissions
Two years of foreign language in high school or one year of foreign language in college (or equivalent proficiency exam) prior to graduation.
Graduation
None

courseSection4.text:
Additional Requirements
Special Non-Course Requirements:
  Major Ensemble Participation
Selected from University Chorus, Women's Chorus, Symphony Orchestra, Concert Band, Wind Ensemble, and Marching Band. Four hours of Jazz Ensemble may be used as Major Ensemble credit.
Ensemble assignment is by the Ensemble directors.
Students must take Major Ensemble during each semester at UCF.
Students taking a course in Performance must concurrently take a major ensemble appropriate to their principal instrument or voice.
Minor Ensemble Participation
If Minor Ensemble is taken at UCF, the semester hours of credit must be spread over at least two separate semesters.
If Minor Ensemble credits are transferred to UCF, each remaining credit must be taken in a separate semester.
Minor Ensembles include: Brass, Percussion, Piano, Madrigal Singers, Women's Chorus, Opera Workshop, Woodwind, Jazz Ensemble, Jazz Combo, and Early Music Ensemble.
Signature Experience
Signature Experience requirement is met by successful completion of the following course(s):

MUS 4954 - Recital Performance II Credit Hours: 0

Required Minors

None

courseSection5.text:
Departmental Exit Requirements

Earn a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in each Music course.

courseSection6.text:
University Minimum Exit Requirements
A 2.0 UCF GPA
42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.

courseSection8.text:
Additional Information

Honors In Major
Students interested in completing Honors in the Major should contact their program advisor. More information about Honors in the Major can be found at http://research.honors.ucf.edu/honors-in-the-Major.
Related Programs
Music Education (B.M.E.)
Music (B.A.)
Theatre, Musical Theatre Track (B.F.A.)
Certificates
None
Related Minors
Music Minor
Theatre Minor
Digital Media Minor
Advising Notes
None
Transfer Notes
Lower division courses do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses transferred from private and out-of-state schools must be evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide all supporting information.
Acceptable Substitutes for Transfer Courses
None
Program Academic Learning Compacts
Program Academic Learning Compacts (student learning outcomes) for undergraduate programs are located at: http://www.oeas.ucf.edu/alc/academic_learning_compacts.htm
Equipment Fees
Part-Time Student: $45 per term
Full-Time Student: $90 per term
